05680D6343E343239272398380AD98D0.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in manufacturing technology (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan, photographs of a project, technical drawings, reports, assignments), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

E36AFDC5613F4D0886F138444800F1A5.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the manufacturing industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, initiative, working independently);

372292EF92A64260A6C2BBDF6106186B.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the manufacturing industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., decision making, job task planning and organizing, problem solving);

B0B63991D10A4925871DFAFFBECAE664.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the manufacturing industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

E4449917663F44CBA74B9DC5239A9B5E.description: identify opportunities available locally to obtain certifications and/or training that it would be beneficial to have if they are pursuing a career in manufacturing (e.g., cardiopulmonary resuscitation [CPR], Standard First Aid, fall protection training);

F58943B4A6B542B6993C73E6293B83D2.description: identify manufacturing-related college programs and apprenticeships that are available in the manufacturing industry prior to or immediately following graduation;

F2BAC5CCD0FE439E849E8941435DF725.description: identify employment opportunities available in the manufacturing industry locally, provincially, and nationally;

A921D99B52584C18BC1C709EB1107251.description: Career Opportunities: . demonstrate an understanding of career opportunities in the manufacturing industry and the education, training, and certification required for these careers.

04C97399402E46E4A30CE5FB60DDB3ED.description: use protective clothing and equipment as required to ensure their own and others’ safety in the work environment.

C562E1287016446EA65EFC6D06D374AD.description: use proper ventilation systems to control air quality (e.g., to minimize the effects of welding fumes, plastic off-gassing, cutting-fluid misting, heat treating of metal);

FAE320EC66F54DE394D52DFC35FCBB77.description: demonstrate the safe use of tools and equipment in compliance with safety manuals, instructions, and institutional requirements;

6E21BD4267524925BF49D81CEFA91B78.description: demonstrate an understanding of procedures to ensure safe and productive work practices in the manufacturing workplace (e.g., perform safety inspections and audits that include ergonomic considerations related to workshop layout and set-up, material handling, ease of movement, lighting, workstation set-up);

B44E2277BC8645DF896AB8F2C68492F6.description: handle materials safely and appropriately in compliance with the information included in the Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) from the Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS);

FC0ED1AE4224409594129ED61CE899CC.description: demonstrate good housekeeping practices in the work environment (e.g., cleaning up spills and leaks, keeping areas clean and clear of obstructions, properly organizing tools and equipment);

4CB43E60D4EE47BE8968A1D2B1421271.description: identify and explain the importance of the specific components of legislation and standards related to workplace safety in the manufacturing industry (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS]) and the specific responsibilities of the relevant oversight/regulatory organizations (e.g., Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB], Industrial Accident Prevention Association [IAPA], Construction Safety Association of Ontario [CSAO])

E4549F13CDD04097906701A2AF938693.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and compliance with health and safety legislation, standards, and practices related to the manufacturing industry;

D7237A9B68CE43C19FD11C90FAAF0178.description: identify ways in which the manufacturing industry affects the culture and society of a community or region (e.g., by creating employment opportunities; supporting social and cultural activities in the community; increasing industrial activity in the community/region, which some people may see as a threat to their way of life and/or the environment).

1959B5E9F36C4E2AA390D87D09E77235.description: explain how ergonomics and a good manufacturing work environment can affect people’s daily lives (e.g., by providing long-term health benefits, creating job efficiencies).

DBAAF7CB5B29422D85C27730F3344BFA.description: describe how the manufacturing industry responds to changes in the global economy (e.g., fluctuating currencies, trade agreements, fluctuating demand in other countries) and how this response affects the local community and/ or the province as a whole (e.g., in terms of economic opportunities or risks for the local and/or provincial population);

9F4290721D914EDA8CE0E76F82E08A90.description: explain how the manufacturing industry affects the local and provincial economy (e.g., with respect to job creation, standards of living, sustainability and conservation of the environment, impact on First Nation communities);

368C7475188B427784D639226E287BAF.description: Technology and Society: demonstrate an understanding of ways in which the manufacturing industry affects society.

4ABC60F6CC964AD99C8AAB9BC9A41289.description: demonstrate the use of proper techniques for the disposal of waste products.

D12B51F6B1A6479FB277F4DEE4BC7CDA.description: describe environmentally responsible practices that can be followed during the design and manufacture of a product (e.g., minimize waste, consider using renewable or recyclable materials, design and manufacture products that last or can be repaired as opposed to throw-away products, use processes that have minimal impact on workers and the local environment);

8A3B1C1D059B43AEAD911021A5BE822E.description: explain how various sources of power generation used in manufacturing (e.g., coal, nuclear, solar, wind, hydrogen fuel cell, tidal, geothermal) affect the environment (e.g., construction of large hydroelectric dams can affect animal habitats and patterns of behaviour);

CF639E0BCA8E4644885F3BD7CE7E7A24.description: identify a variety of alternative fuels (e.g., biodiesel, ethanol, hydrogen, electric power in hybrid systems) and energy sources (e.g., wind power, solar power, waste-to-energy) and explain how use of these fuels and energy sources can reduce the environmental impact of the manufacturing industry;

43978007044B484DA6A749F69B503E39.description: describe the benefits of using environmentally friendly products in the manufacturing process (e.g., the benefits of water-based versus solventbased adhesives);

A30A1FCA2A374BFAA8470EACEAFB3E7B.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of ways in which the manufacturing industry affects the environment;

EAB5DB22420A4A39994AF2717D07BAC2.description: demonstrate the use of various bonding, combining, and/or assembly techniques (e.g., shielded metal arc welding [SMAW], gas metal arc welding [GMAW], gas tungsten arc welding [GTAW], oxy-acetylene welding, brazing, soldering, use of appropriate fasteners, bonding) to complete projects.

E0BD64EE99544060BE886FF795707547.description: demonstrate the correct selection and use of appropriate tools and equipment (e.g., wrenches, electric drills, grinders, engine lathe, milling machine) for specific manufacturing tasks;

46C10E4F346D49EC95EACAAC977CC0C1.description: use appropriate procedures (e.g., correct machine set-up, operational safety procedures) when setting up, maintaining, using, and storing tools and equipment used in manufacturing and production processes;

E47974C051004A35816AB6801DC24CB3.description: demonstrate the use of appropriate bench work techniques to lay out, fit, and assemble workpieces;

0A6B6D85027446338FF0E4B660D4FFBD.description: Tools, Equipment, and Machine Processes: use tools, equipment, and machine processes safely and correctly in the manufacture of a product.

6E77D50D23A64ED0AC43D600BC53E6BA.description: use metrology tools to inspect and evaluate products for quality control purposes (e.g., for inspection reports, destructive and non-destructive testing).

5CC3F3524CED4FF5829B9949237DE414.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of the proper tools required to lay out a product precisely (e.g., height gauge, surface gauge, trammel points, protractor, scribe, straight edge);

850759BB0AA84F9CAD072000FCE024E0.description: apply principles of dimensional metrology (e.g., precision measurement, tolerancing for interchangeable manufacturing) to manufacturing processes when producing a product;

8EB85D38687241D192AEC11870D885A0.description: demonstrate the correct use of various measuring instruments (e.g., scales, vernier calipers, micrometers, gauges) to make measurements in both metric and US customary/British imperial units;

836118B04BBE4C37880FA637A4A69610.description: Metrology Tools: demonstrate a working knowledge of various metrology tools used to measure, lay out, and inspect products;

7D7253E247194B588897D8DA5FADCAF9.description: use the proper procedures to prepare materials for production (e.g., measuring, marking, cutting to rough length, grinding, cleaning, deburring).

9E0E705EEDB246BB807F2A4253C5801D.description: select appropriate materials for a project based on their properties and characteristics (e.g., physical, mechanical, thermal, chemical, electrical, magnetic, optical, acoustical) and the project’s design criteria (e.g., strength, finish, customer specifications, quality control processes, working environment);

0645755B63B645E5AC2530E463A45A0C.description: identify the factors that affect material selection and suitability for the manufacture of a product (e.g., hardness, softness, malleability, mass, durability, shape, size, finish);

4AE07BAE1E5B461AA6A14548E1100B82.description: prepare, using conventional means or computer-aided design (CAD), detailed working drawings and/or assembly drawings or rough sketches (e.g., section views, isometric views), as appropriate to the task, that include the measurements and symbols required to complete a project (e.g., dimensions, specifications, tolerances, surface finish symbols, weldments).

7BA442FD56CD44B3AD493ABA045D5997.description: convert drawing dimensions (e.g., US customary/British imperial units to metric units, fractions to decimals) using the appropriate chart, table, or formula;

E5A9219DE4E04C998AC048BD77D7B88E.description: use appropriate language and terminology (e.g., in oral and written reports) when developing process plans;

E7BB8D25E69945C3BEC89D12498ACF0C.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of the stages of the manufacturing process (e.g., produce an order of operation chart, develop a bill of material for a project, undertake a cost analysis, develop a process plan);

0EE1BC5E51424C7A84847878F1BF03B0.description: Technical Drawings and Process Plans: demonstrate the ability to interpret and prepare technical drawings and develop process plans;

3AAE85D5F15D486EA11EBDC90E944CA8.description: use appropriate forms of communication (e.g., oral and written reports) and supporting documentation (e.g., statistical graphing; sketches; scale drawings; perspectives; orthographic, isometric, and oblique views; pattern and development projections; shop, assembly, and detail drawings) to convey ideas and processes and to show materials and specifications.

654008C5FC62472CAE8A13E7AD8F555A.description: use technical language correctly and appropriately (e.g., in reports and presentations) to communicate information related to manufacturing technology;

22206FEFBB134D7A8061CA10EE76F957.description: describe how the physical and mechanical properties of solid materials (e.g., physical: density, appearance, porosity, surface texture; mechanical: hardness, ductility, elasticity, brittleness, compression, fatigue, shear, tensility) create advantages or disadvantages that affect their suitability for use in manufacturing;

04811797B647402D938C41980597F768.description: identify the properties (e.g., magnetic, physical, mechanical, thermal, electrical) of natural and manufactured solid materials;

A23FC27057964E1B9CFCCF8CEE4C61A6.description: apply scientific laws, theories, and concepts related to the design and production areas of manufacturing (e.g., laws/theories: Newton’s laws of motion, basic electrical theory; concepts: simple machines, mechanical advantage);

5C96DD7C709D41D5B171F3AE2FA82E17.description: apply mathematical analysis skills as they relate to production cost and quality control when manufacturing a product (e.g., conduct a cost analysis of the final product or process, produce statistical process control charts);

D035BECEB3D345AE8BE7C67BA33354AB.description: apply mathematical concepts (e.g., linear systems; integers; decimals and fractions; order of operations) and skills in performing a variety of tasks required within the context of manufacturing design and production (e.g., angle calculations; calculation of perimeter, volume, and area; percent/decimal/fraction conversions; US customary/ British imperial and metric unit conversions);

DD3405DBA29945E5B4C3F2BA97A26130.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of various mathematical formulas (e.g., Pythagorean theorem, formulas for calculating volume and surface area) and applications (e.g., tap drill sizing, calculation of machine speeds and feeds, weight calculations) that are commonly used in manufacturing;

12978271814040B9891CC7E4B42E4691.description: operate a basic control system (e.g., electronic, pneumatic, hydraulic, mechanical) to control a robot or component in completing a simple task.

4CF679D795E144A3AE5050312DA8A00D.description: explain the use of control system technologies (e.g., electronic – programmable logic controller [PLC]; hydraulic; mechanical; pneumatic) in a production process or project;

0B4AC8524D1C468F91A207A54E7537FA.description: describe various manufacturing control systems (e.g., inventory/purchasing control, quality control);

54D344E7DC634F81A63C02A649BF5025.description: Control Systems: demonstrate an understanding of various types of control systems used in manufacturing;

BBE7643ED38148CBBB36426097F067C7.description: demonstrate a working knowledge of converting the structure of a material, using a variety of methods (e.g., heat treating, annealing, steaming, shrinking, tempering).

47A56D9C215F46DE8D733D038F37B2C0.description: describe material conversions such as the separation process (e.g., converting a material’s size and shape by removing excess material); the addition process (e.g., combining materials to achieve enhanced qualities, as in alloys); the process of making changes to contours (e.g., assembling materials by such means as gluing, mixing, fastening, bonding, welding); and the process of changing the properties (e.g., thermal, chemical, mechanical, physical) of solid materials;

2E94C0D21F294DEB967A080DEC3FA253.description: describe and demonstrate the correct use of a variety of processes for forming materials, using various tools and equipment (e.g., hammers; brake press; rollers; forging, casting, and moulding equipment);

B2CC0440878742EBA69AA02C56EBBC8C.description: describe and demonstrate the correct use of a variety of processes for cutting materials (e.g., using oxy-acetylene torches, saws, shears, a plasma cutter, an engine lathe, a milling machine);

557039D069D4415FA93A719FB8919D3B.description: describe and demonstrate the correct use of a variety of processes for joining materials (e.g., welding, bonding, fastening);

F7FC5D0F1A664AEC93C84381E7BC82C9.description: Material Conversion: demonstrate an understanding of material conversion processes;

44CFB15F5CC24679A31EEEE8571BEB9B.description: use brainstorming strategies, web diagrams, and trial-and-error activities as part of the design process to develop the best possible solution to a manufacturing challenge.

9B477C5071514276803D251109633AAE.description: explain why technological concepts (e.g., aesthetics, control, environmental sustainability/ stewardship, ergonomics, fabrication, function, innovation, material, mechanism, power and energy, structure, safety, systems) are important considerations in the design process

1B71B855521E4BF7B59D44FABD346A1A.description: describe some examples of how the design process has been used in manufacturing to develop new products, or to improve existing products, to meet human needs or wants (e.g., quality of automobiles improved through the use of robotics in the manufacturing process);

BCB0E17F1EA84F34AE7D9F801527638B.description: describe and explain the importance of the steps in a design process (e.g., analysing the situation, defining the need or problem, conducting research, generating solutions, communicating ideas, evaluating solutions, building a prototype, undertaking a cost analysis) or other problemsolving process used to solve a variety of manufacturing technology challenges (e.g., design and plan the fabrication of a robot or robotic work cell to specific design criteria and timelines)

AFB5D6BBF8F14CD1A7507E65EABC07FF.description: Design Process: demonstrate an understanding of how a design process is used in the planning and development of a manufacturing project;
